titleStmt.title: Description of Medical and calendrical works.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Or 2674: Medical and calendrical works. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. The [British] Library respects the intellectual property rights, including moral rights, of rights holders and makes all reasonable effort to contact and consult rights owners, including, where appropriate, communities directly, or via local community organisations. Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. notesStmt.note: Tidemarks at all edges throughout. Foxing. Usage stains. Worming at end. Ink partly pale.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Luḥot ṿe-῾inyene teḳufot לוחות ועניני תקופות
Luḥot ṿe-῾inyene teḳufot לוחות ועניני תקופות
Luḥot ṿe-῾inyene teḳufot לוחות ועניני תקופות

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century. Shabtai ben Yeḥiel of Rome: a part of his name is given at the beginning of each section between folios 119v-122r.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Mafte'ach Ha-Refu'ah. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2674.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira(b. 1830, d. 1884), antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 10 October 1883: inscribed, folio [150v] (fse003v).
